caption.text: Scenarios characterising disruption to HIV services due to the COVID-19 epidemic.

cell.text:
-No new ART enrolments
-No new VMMCs

-Sexual contacts decrease by 10%

-No new ART enrolments
-No new VMMCs
-(No PrEP enrolment or prescription refills
*
)
-Viral suppression decreases by 10% across individuals on ART
-40% of individuals on ART go off ART for duration of disruption, assuming a mean monthly mortality risk of 0.24% during the disruption

-Condom use decreases by 50%
-Sexual contacts decrease by 10%

statement.text: -No new ART enrolments -No new VMMCs -(No PrEP enrolment or prescription refills ) -Viral suppression decreases by 10% across individuals on ART -40% of individuals on ART go off ART for duration of disruption, assuming a mean monthly mortality risk of 0.24% during the disruption -Condom use decreases by 50% -Sexual contacts decrease by 10% is in assumed impact on hiv programs

The value -No new ART enrolments -No new VMMCs -(No PrEP enrolment or prescription refills ) -Viral suppression decreases by 10% across individuals on ART -Condom use decreases by 50% -Sexual contacts decrease by 10% belongs to assumed impact on hiv programs
-No new ART enrolments -No new VMMCs -(No new PrEP enrolments ) -Sexual contacts decrease by 10% is in assumed impact on hiv programs
There are no duplicate values in assumed impact on hiv programs
Assumed impact on hiv programs always has the same value.

caption.text: Alternative assumptions used for the risk of death experienced by those PLHIV whose ART supply is interrupted.

cell.text: Proportion that would die after one year
This is a hypothetical best-case scenario in which the vast majority of individuals do not deteriorate rapidly.

The SMART trial found a 3% risk at 12 months of either death of an opportunistic infection for those with interrupted ART
[13]
. This also implies a mean survival time approximately equivalent to that for HIV-positive persons who have never been on ART
[14]
.
This is the hypothetical worst-case scenario in which many persons deteriorate more rapidly.

statement.text: The value of 0.10% for average monthly mortality risk corresponds to the value of This is a hypothetical best-case scenario in which the vast majority of individuals do not deteriorate rapidly. for justification
The average monthly mortality risk is 0.44% when the proportion that would die after one year is 5.28%
